0.title: I'm not assessing my performances at all, just enjoying my game: Ashwin
0.article_body: Opening up on his recent performances, India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said he's in a "very good space of mind" and "just enjoying" his game. "I'm not in that phase of my life where I'm thinking about what happened," added Ashwin. "The last two years have been hard on a lot of people but...kind and good to me," he further said.

1.title: Cong leader demands reopening of Hyderabad's Charminar for prayers
1.article_body: Telangana Congress leader Rashid Khan has started a signature campaign demanding the reopening of Hyderabad's Charminar for offering prayers. Prayers were earlier held, however, Muslims were debarred from offering prayers at the site two decades ago, he claimed. This comes amid the ongoing row over the restoration of an alleged temple complex on the Qutub Minar premises in Delhi.

2.title: Kenyan national attacks pedestrians with knife near Bombay HC, held
2.article_body: One person suffered serious injuries after a Kenyan national attacked at least seven pedestrians near Bombay High Court on Wednesday. Mumbai Police arrested the 50-year-old foreigner who also sustained injuries. Police said the accused got violent after a verbal altercation with his female friend following which he went on to attack pedestrians randomly from Parsi Bawdi area with a knife.

3.title: BJP loves to weaponise pain of Kashmiri Pandits: PDP
3.article_body: The BJP loves to weaponise the pain of the Kashmiri Pandits, said the PDP in its monthly newsletter 'Speak Up' on Tuesday. Referring to the recent killing of a government official, Rahul Bhat, the article titled 'The Saffron Trojan Horse' said, "Kashmiri Pandits get teargassed by the police for protesting [against] the killing of Rahul Bhat."

4.title: Man throws acid on colleague after fight in Bengaluru; arrested
4.article_body: A 30-year-old jewellery shop employee has been arrested for allegedly throwing acid at his colleague after a fight over a petty issue in Bengaluru. The incident reportedly took place when both the men went out to drink after work with two other friends. The victim, Mantu Santra, has suffered 30% burn injuries on his face, neck and chest.

5.title: Gunman kills 4 before shooting himself at hospital in US
5.article_body: A man armed with a rifle and a handgun killed four people inside a medical building on a hospital campus in Tulsa, Oklahoma before fatally shooting himself, police said. Multiple injuries had also been confirmed, officials said. Police added that they were trying to determine the suspect's identity, who they estimated was aged between 35 and 40.

6.title: Amber issues statement after losing Depp's defamation trial, says 'I'm heartbroken'
6.article_body: Amber Heard, in a statement issued after she lost Johnny Depp's defamation trial, said, "I'm heartbroken that the mountain of evidence...wasn't enough to stand up to the disproportionate power...and sway of my ex-husband." Calling it a "setback", Amber added, "I'm sadder...that I seem to have lost a right I thought I had as an American- to speak freely and openly."

7.title: 22-yr-old man killed for refusing to give beer bottles in Delhi, 3 held
7.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death by three men after he refused to give his beer bottles to them in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar, police said. The accused were nabbed after we conducted raids, DCP (North-West) Usha Rangnani added. The accused were in front of a mall after spending all their money and saw the victim carrying beer bottles.

8.title: Depp issues statement after winning defamation trial, says 'Jury gave me my life back'
8.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp took to Instagram to issue a statement after winning the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. "[The] jury gave me my life back. I'm truly humbled," he wrote. "From the very beginning, the goal of bringing this case was to reveal...truth, regardless of the outcome," he added. "A new chapter has finally begun," he wrote.

9.title: Cricketer Deepak Chahar marries girlfriend Jaya Bhardwaj, shares pic
9.article_body: Cricketer Deepak Chahar tied the knot with his girlfriend Jaya Bhardwaj on Wednesday after dating for more than a year. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Deepak wrote, "When I met you first time I felt that you are the one...and I was right." He further wrote, "One of the best moment of my life."

10.title: Lost 30 kg, my mom asked 'Why're you killing yourself': Randeep on Sarbjit
10.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda said he lost 30 kilos while preparing for 'Sarbjit'. He added that his mother, who was staying with him, left and asked why he was killing himself. "She said I can't see you do this...She tried to stop me...She would make things that I like," Randeep said, adding that his mother said she "can't take it anymore".

11.title: Green corridor in Delhi helps transport liver across 8 km in 7 minutes
11.article_body: A green corridor created by the Delhi Traffic Police on Wednesday helped transport a liver for transplant across eight kilometres in seven minutes. A road accident victim's family wanted to donate the liver to a 38-year-old Army officer. The ambulance with the liver started from AIIMS Trauma Centre at 9:24 am and reached the Army Hospital (R&R) at 9:31 am.

12.title: Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg to step down after 14 years
12.article_body: Meta Platforms' Chief Operating Officer (COO) Sheryl Sandberg has announced she's stepping down from her position. "It's a decision I didn't come to lightly, but it's been 14 years," Sandberg wrote in a Facebook post, adding that she plans to focus on her foundation and philanthropic work going forward. Meta's Chief Growth Officer Javier Olivan will take over as COO.

13.title: Johnny Depp wins defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard, awarded $15 million
13.article_body: A jury has ruled in favour of Johnny Depp in his libel lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard. He was awarded $10 million in compensatory damages and $5 million in punitive damages. Depp sued Heard for libel  over a December 2018 op-ed she wrote in The Washington Post describing herself as "a public figure representing domestic abuse".

14.title: Good Vibes offers 'buy 1 get 1 free' during Purplle I Heart Beauty Sale
14.article_body: Cruelty-free & nature-inspired personal care brand Good Vibes announced that it brings you innovative products with clean, exotic ingredients like Bakuchiol, Rosehip, Vitamin C, and more to get that elusive summer glow. Serum or sunscreen, body wash or facewash, its products are highly trusted with 95% being 4+ rated, it added, offering buy 1 get 1 free exclusively on Purplle.com.

15.title: Assistant director started shaking after he saw me: Kamal Haasan on Chachi 420
15.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan recalled an incident from the sets of his 1997 film 'Chachi 420' on The Kapil Sharma Show. When Kapil asked Kamal, "When 'Chachi 420' came, did anyone from the village, where you were shooting fell for you?" Kamal replied, "The assistant director came to...me...And then when I looked down, he started shaking because my sari's pallu fell."

16.title: We don't interfere in each other's life: Akshay on his wife Twinkle
16.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that he and his wife-author Twinkle Khanna think in opposite directions. "It works...weirdly," he added. When asked whether they share input about work with each other, Akshay said they don't interfere in each other's life. "If she asks me to read her column, I will read it...If not asked, I keep myself aside," he added.

17.title: Poland's economy will gain by helping Ukraine: PM Morawiecki
17.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said on Wednesday the country will get economic boost from helping Ukraine. Morawiecki, who made the comment while inaugurating temporary housing arrangement for Ukrainians in Warsaw, added that Poland could benefit by re-exporting Ukrainian grains and re-building infrastructure in Ukraine. Poland has taken in over 3 million Ukrainian refugees since Russian invasion.

18.title: BJP worked to make 8 years of Modi govt unmatchable: JP Nadda
18.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said that the party has worked to make the eight years of PM Narendra Modi-led government unmatchable. This, he said, includes service, good governance and welfare of the poor. Addressing party workers in Bhopal, Nadda said, "Let us make our work universal and inclusive, let's work to reach out to all sections of the society."

19.title: Policemen assault Dalit youth in UP for 'staring at them'; probe ordered
19.article_body: A Dalit youth was allegedly assaulted by police in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow for "staring at policemen" while he stepped out to watch his neighbours fight. He also alleged he was beaten and subjected to third-degree torture after he was taken to the police station. The accused police personnel have been suspended and a probe has been launched into the matter.

20.title: Sidharth, Kiara dance together at Karan Johar's party; video goes viral
20.article_body: Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, who are rumoured to be dating, recently attended Karan Johar's 50th birthday party which was held in Mumbai. Now, a video surfaced online, which showed Sidharth and Kiara dancing together to Amitabh Bachchan's song 'Jumma Chumma De De'. The duo also shared a hug at the end of the video.

21.title: Decision on textbook review after comprehensive report: K'taka CM
21.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that the decision on textbook review would be taken after getting a comprehensive report by the Primary and Secondary Education Minister on the issue. "We will get the report tomorrow and it will be discussed with the litterateurs," Bommai said. Opinion of the seers and others will also be considered, he added.

22.title: Not the time to lose hope: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra to Cong workers
22.article_body: Speaking at the 'Nav Sankalp Shivir' in Lucknow, Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra told party workers that "this is not the time to lose hope". Lauding workers' fight in the recent polls, she said, "Entire country saw how (Uttar Pradesh) Congress workers, leaders fought. At Udaipur Shivir many told me that they were inspired by the way...Congress workers fought."

23.title: 16 lakh WhatsApp accounts banned in India in April
23.article_body: In its monthly report, Meta-owned instant messaging platform WhatsApp stated that it banned 16,66,000 accounts in India between April 1 and 30. It stated that 122 accounts were banned based on user complaints. The report has been published in accordance with the Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021.

24.title: Candlelight protest held in Srinagar against teacher's killing
24.article_body: Locals and activists staged a candlelight protest in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar against the increased targeted killing of civilians in the union territory. The protest was held after a teacher, identified as Rajni, was killed by terrorists at a school in the Gopalpora area of Kulgam. Protesters held placards, candles during the protest.

25.title: ED attaches 33 PFI accounts with ₹68 lakh in money laundering case
25.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached at least 33 bank accounts with over ₹68 lakh of Popular Front of India (PFI) and a linked organisation called Rehab India Foundation in a money laundering case, officials said. Officials added that 23 accounts of PFI having ₹59,12,051 and 10 of Rehab India Foundation having ₹9,50,030 have been attached.

26.title: 52-yr-old Mumbai teacher cheated of ₹7.15 lakh by Facebook 'friend'
26.article_body: A 52-year-old teacher from Mumbai's Vikhroli was cheated of ₹7.15 lakh by a Facebook "friend", claiming to be an orthopaedic surgeon from England. Police said the complainant received a friend request on Facebook from an account named Victor Rolad. Rolad told the complainant that he had sent her gifts and asked her to pay ₹7.15 lakh "customs duty", police added.

27.title: Singer KK's mortal remains brought to Mumbai for last rites
27.article_body: The mortal remains of singer KK have been brought to Mumbai from Kolkata, a day after he passed away at the age of 53 after a live performance. His last rites will be held in the city on Thursday, according to reports. The singer died due to cardiac arrest, according to preliminary findings of post-mortem.

28.title: Dangerous: Russia warns US against supplying new arms to Ukraine
28.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov reacted to US' decision to supply Ukraine with new weapons, including advanced rocket systems, calling the move "dangerous". The delivery of such weapons increases the risk of drawing the US into a direct conflict with Russia, Moscow said. The rocket systems will help Ukrainians "repel Russian advances on Ukrainian territory", a US official said.

29.title: CCTV footage shows KK walking with towel around neck in hotel moments before he collapsed
29.article_body: CCTV footage has emerged showing singer KK walking in the corridor of a Kolkata hotel before he was taken to hospital after he reportedly complained of chest pain. In the video, the singer is seen walking with a towel around his neck after a performance at a Kolkata auditorium. Preliminary post-mortem report indicated that he died of cardiac arrest.

30.title: Singer KK died due to cardiac arrest, indicates preliminary post-mortem report
30.article_body: Preliminary findings of post-mortem conducted on Bollywood singer Krishnakumar Kunnath, popularly known as KK, indicates that he died due to cardiac arrest, said police. The singer had passed away on Tuesday following a live concert in Kolkata. His body was brought to Mumbai on Wednesday and his funeral will be held tomorrow, said reports.

31.title: Civilian shot at by terrorists in J&K's Shopian; condition stable
31.article_body: Terrorists fired upon a civilian, Farooq Ahmad Sheikh, in Keegam area of Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Wednesday. He received an injury in his leg and has been shifted to hospital, Kashmir Zone police said. His condition is stated to be stable, the police added. The incident comes a day after a female school teacher was shot dead in Kulgam.

32.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father immerses late singer's ashes at Kiratpur Sahib
32.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father arrived in Kiratpur Sahib to immerse his son's mortal remains. A large crowd gathered at Kartarpur Sahib to pay their respects to the singer. In the pictures, a relative was seen carrying a large framed picture of Sidhu Moosewala as they arrived for the post-funeral rites. His father also broke down as he immersed his ashes.

33.title: PM taught me to cook perfect khichdi in 1997: Shimla BJP leader's wife
33.article_body: A day after PM Narendra Modi visited Shimla, BJP leader Deepak Sharma's wife recalled how he taught her to cook perfect 'sabu dana khichdi' when he was BJP's Himachal Pradesh unit in-charge in 1997. Seema Sharma said she had cooked khichdi for PM Modi during Navratras but it didn't meet his expectations. He then showed her how to cook it.

34.title: Gifted artists like you made this life more bearable: AR Rahman on singer KK
34.article_body: Music composer AR Rahman took to his Twitter handle and paid tribute to singer KK. He wrote, "Dear KK...what’s the hurry buddy...gifted singers and artists like you made this life more bearable..#RIPKK." Composer Harris Jayaraj also tweeted, "My Uyirin Uyire passed away. I am completely shattered and my condolences to his family and friends."

35.title: 9-yr-old sells her hair to help Ukrainian army amid Russia war
35.article_body: A 9-year-old girl chopped off her long hair and sold it to raise funds for Ukrainian army amid the ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine. The girl, Kira Hubina, a resident of Ukraine's Chernihiv earned 3,500 hryvnias (over ₹9,000) after selling her hair, which she then donated to the armed forces. Russia's invasion of Ukraine has entered its fourth month.

36.title: Bengali singer criticised over 'Who is KK?' remark made before his death, clarifies
36.article_body: Bengali singer Rupankar Bagchi clarified after criticism over his Facebook live, recorded a day before KK's death, wherein he claimed West Bengal has better singers. "KK, KK...who's KK?" he had said. "What I meant to say...was people of...Bengal...must be more proud of Bengali...songs. I spoke in favour of retaining our culture," he stated and said KK was a great singer.

37.title: Sri Lanka to return to higher tax rates to win IMF aid amid crisis
37.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has proposed to raise tax rates to meet conditions that would make the country eligible for bailout package from International Monetary Fund (IMF) amid economic crisis. Telecom levy, standard corporate tax and VAT rates will increase "over the immediate term", PM said. Notably, World Bank is reportedly set to disburse $700 million to cash-strapped country.

38.title: NEET-PG results declared in record 10 days
38.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday announced that NEET-PG results have been declared. "I congratulate all the students who have qualified for NEET-PG with flying colours. I appreciate [National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences] for their commendable job of declaring the results in record 10 days, much ahead of the schedule," he tweeted.

39.title: Sri Lanka seeking $3 bn under IMF's Extended Fund Facility: Report
39.article_body: Sri Lanka is in talks with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to borrow $3 billion under the latter's Extended Fund Facility, Reuters reported. Sri Lanka expects another round of technical talks with IMF in early June and hopes to reach a staff-level agreement by June-end. A taxation overhaul to boost revenue was announced by the Lankan government on Tuesday.

40.title: Bihar to conduct caste-based count in set time frame: CM Nitish
40.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said a caste-based count will be held in Bihar by a set deadline. "Soon a cabinet decision will be taken and it'll be available in public domain," he said after an all-party meeting. "Now that Centre has made it clear that nationwide caste census couldn't be done, we decided to go with state census," Kumar added.

41.title: Nepal issues revised rules for flight permits after Tara air crash
41.article_body: The Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal (CAAN) on Tuesday revised rules for flight permits after 22 people were killed in Tara Air plane crash on Sunday. According to new rules, flight permits will be granted after en-route weather conditions, along with weather at source and destination airports, are looked into. Preliminary probe has indicated that poor weather led to crash.

42.title: Kareena was never part of the film, Karisma was the 1st choice: Suneel on Andaaz
42.article_body: As 'Andaaz' completed 19 years, producer Suneel Darshan was asked whether Kareena Kapoor Khan and Karisma Kapoor were first choices for the film, he replied, "Kareena was never a part of the film." "Karisma...was the first choice for the role which was played by Lara Dutta. I was...enthusiastic to have Karisma...She has been...part of every movie of mine," he added.

43.title: Qatar prince's ex-wife found dead at her home in Spain; drug overdose suspected
43.article_body: Qatar Prince Abdelaziz bin Khalifa Al-Thani's former wife Kasia Gallanio has been found dead at her home in Spain. Spanish officials suspect the 45-year-old died of a drug overdose. Gallanio, who married the Qatari royal in 2004, had fought legal battle over custody of their three daughters for 10 years after allegations that he sexually assaulted their eldest child.

44.title: BJP to hold national executive meeting in Hyderabad on July 2 & 3
44.article_body: The BJP will hold its national executive meeting in Hyderabad on July 2 and 3. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah, BJP chief JP Nadda and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh are among the leaders who will attend the two-day event. It is the key decision making body of the BJP.

45.title: I get unfair privileges: Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah on being a star kid
45.article_body: During an AMA (Ask Me Anything) session, filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah Kashyap on Wednesday, responded to a fan on Instagram, who asked if star kids are privileged. She agreed and wrote, "I've...no interest...in being an actor...I love content creation...that's what I want to do. But I know...being a part of the family I'm, I still get unfair privileges."

46.title: Mexico bans sale of e-cigarettes on 'World No Tobacco Day'
46.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Tuesday announced the ban of e-cigarettes and other vaping devices in the country, along with several other anti-smoking measures to mark 'World No Tobacco Day'. PM Obrador stated that vaping devices have been designed to appeal to the youth but are "harmful to human health". Mexico had previously banned the import of e-cigarettes.

47.title: Mumbai sees 739 new COVID cases, 46% spike in 1 day; positivity rate at 8.4%
47.article_body: Mumbai reported 739 fresh COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, a spike of 46% from Tuesday when the city saw 506 cases. The positivity rate rose to 8.4%, while the number of active cases in the city stood at 2,970. Amid rising cases in the city, BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal has asked his staff to ramp up testing and vaccination.

48.title: Info Edge-backed edtech startup Udayy shuts down, lays off all employees
48.article_body: Gurugram-based edtech startup Udayy shut down its operations in April, three years after its inception, Co-founder Saumya Yadav said on Wednesday. Yadav said that as children started returning to offline classes, the Info Edge-backed startup faced roadblocks in growing its online learning model. Due to the shutdown, around 100 employees were laid off and were paid a severance package.

49.title: Rhea Chakraborty allowed to travel abroad for IIFA Awards under conditions
49.article_body: A special court in Mumbai permitted Rhea Chakraborty, an accused in a drugs case, to travel to Abu Dhabi from June 2-5 to attend IIFA Awards. Court directed NCB to hand over Chakraborty's passport to her. It said she shall appear before Indian Embassy in Abu Dhabi daily to mark attendance, submit her itinerary to NCB and resurrender her passport.

50.title: Extremely irresponsible: BJP leader on TN Minister's COVID-19 remark
50.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister and BJP leader Jitin Prasada criticised Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian's remarks, calling it "extremely irresponsible and derogatory". "Disease and pandemics do not know any state boundaries or borders as we have all experienced," Prasada tweeted. His tweet came after Ma Subramanian blamed North Indian students for COVID-19 spread in Tamil Nadu.

51.title: Bus conductor robbed of ₹10,000, gold chain at gunpoint in Punjab
51.article_body: Three men fired in the air and robbed the conductor of a PEPSU Road Transport Corporation (PRTC) bus of ₹10,000 and a gold chain near Punjab's Ludhiana, police said. All 52 passengers on the bus, including the driver and the conductor were unhurt. Police added that CCTV footage showed the three men following bus on a motorcycle and a scooter.

52.title: Mock drills to be held at Gurugram underpasses to prevent flooding
52.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) will conduct mock drills at 10 underpasses on Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway and Golf Course Road from June 1 to 7 to prevent waterlogging during monsoon, officials said. They added that functioning of dewatering pumps and generators will be checked. The fire department will deploy fire tenders to release water into the underpasses, officials said.

53.title: Vietnam develops African Swine Fever vaccine for commercial use
53.article_body: Vietnam said on Wednesday that it has created a vaccine to administer to pigs to fight African Swine Fever (ASF), stating that it is the first country that will commercially produce and export the product. The vaccine is expected to provide six-month-long immunity and had been in the works since 2019. ASF is a livestock disease and doesn't infect humans.

54.title: Delhi Police busts kidney racket, 10 including a doctor arrested
54.article_body: The Delhi Police busted a kidney racket gang in South Delhi and arrested 10 persons from parts of the national capital. According to the police, one of the arrested persons is a doctor and the others are technicians and helpers. "During interrogation, the detained doctor revealed that he charged lakhs of rupees from a patient for an operation," police said.

55.title: Crude oil price crosses $117 mark over EU's Russian oil ban
55.article_body: Crude oil price crossed the $117 mark on Wednesday after European Union agreed to a phased ban on Russian oil and as China ended its COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai. While Brent crude rose $1.80 to $117.40/barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) was up $1.63 to $116.30/barrel at 6:03 pm. May is the sixth consecutive month recording rising crude oil prices.

56.title: ACB arrests Mumbai policeman for accepting ₹70,000 as bribe
56.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials arrested an assistant police inspector while accepting a bribe of ₹70,000 from a businessman in Mumbai's Khar locality. The ACB officials said that the accused police officer, Swapnil Masalkar, demanded money from the businessman for not filing an FIR against him. After the businessman approached the ACB, they laid a trap and arrested the policeman.

57.title: 29-yr-old murder accused escapes from police custody in Palghar
57.article_body: A 29-year-old murder accused, Vijay Choudhary, escaped from police custody in Maharashtra's Palghar, an official said. The official from Mokhada Police Station said that the accused was taken to Nashik for interrogation. While returning, the police van developed a snag and the policemen and the accused got down from the vehicle. This was when the accused escaped, the official added.

58.title: Nothing is overdose in India: Ravi Shastri on possibility of 2 IPL editions in a year
58.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that holding two IPL editions in a year is a possibility. "That's the way it's going to go. That's the way it's developed as a beast of a property. And you cannot hide away from that," he added. "You might think that's overdose, but nothing is overdose in India," Shastri stated.

59.title: Will cost $2 to intercept each rocket: Israeli PM on laser shield
59.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said on Wednesday that a new laser-based air defence system, the Iron Beam, will reduce interception cost for each drone or missile to $2. "This is a game-changer, not just because we're striking at...enemy military, but also because we are bankrupting it," he said. Bennett said that the system is likely to be deployed next year.

60.title: IAS officer shares 3 advices for those who cleared UPSC exam, says 'will benefit others'
60.article_body: After UPSC Civil Services Exam, 2021 results were announced, IAS officer Awanish Sharan tweeted three advices for the newly selected candidates, stating that it would be beneficial for other aspiring candidates. "Avoid naming the coaching institutes from which you have not studied. Recommend only those text materials which you have studied. Share your experience as much as possible," he tweeted.

61.title: He always sang with open heart, I'm heartbroken: R Madhavan on singer KK
61.article_body: Remembering KK, actor R Madhavan said that the singer sang 'Sach Keh Raha Hai', "It was emotional, it had betrayal and half the expressions in that song came about because of the way he sang it," he added. "He always sang with an open heart and the irony is that's the only thing that gave up. I'm heartbroken," he said.

62.title: Sourav Ganguly has not resigned as BCCI President: Jay Shah on resignation reports
62.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah has clarified that Sourav Ganguly has not resigned as BCCI President after reports claimed that Ganguly has tendered his resignation. Reports surfaced after Ganguly shared a tweet, wherein he said that he is planning to "start something" that he feels will "probably help a lot of people".

63.title: What BJP is doing isn't expected, stop politicising KK's death: TMC
63.article_body: After BJP and Congress demanded an impartial probe into singer KK's death in Kolkata, TMC state General Secretary Kunal Ghosh asked the parties to not politicise his death. "What BJP is doing isn't...expected. [It] should stop its vulture brand of politics," he said. The TMC leader added, "We won't be astonished if BJP starts claiming...KK was their party leader."

64.title: Today, I'm planning to start something I feel will probably help a lot of people: Ganguly
64.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly took to Twitter and wrote, "Today...I'm planning to start something...I feel will probably help a lot of people." In the tweet, Ganguly said 2022 marked the 30th year since start of his cricket journey and stated, "I want to thank every single person who has been a part of journey...and helped me reach where I'm today."

65.title: Delhi airport introduces RFID tags to track check-in luggage
65.article_body: Indira Gandhi International Airport became the first in India to introduce radio frequency identification (RFID) tags to help passengers track real-time status of their check-in baggage. The tags, which will be called 'Bagg Trax', have been launched for select frequent flyers at Terminal 3 under a pilot project. Flyers will receive updates on their baggage status via real-time SMS alerts.

66.title: Restaurant manager run over by colleague in eatery's van in Mumbai
66.article_body: A 62-year-old restaurant manager in Mumbai died after he was allegedly run over by his colleague on Monday, police said. The accused, Dinesh Kewat, was assigned some task for which he needed to take the restaurant's van. "As soon as he started the van, he lost control over it...mowing down the manager [of the restaurant]," a police officer said.

67.title: Musk tells Tesla employees to return to office or quit, shows alleged leaked email
67.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday notified his staff that remote work is no longer acceptable at the company, according to an alleged leaked email. Musk reportedly wrote, "Anyone who wishes to do remote work must be in...office for...minimum of 40 hours per week or depart Tesla." He also reportedly clarified the "office" must be a main Tesla office.

68.title: 13-yr-old Pune boy climbs Kala Patthar in Nepal, unfurls Tricolour
68.article_body: A 13-year-old boy, Sai Sudhir Kawade, from Pune, climbed the Kala Patthar mountain in Nepal at an elevation of 5644.5 metres. Sai was the youngest mountaineer to participate in the Tenzing Hillary Everest Marathon. Reports said that 45 countries participated in the annual marathon. Sai unfurled a 175-feet Tricolour after climbing the peak.

69.title: I needed money, had bills to pay: Sonali Bendre on doing 'cringe' films
69.article_body: Sonali Bendre said she did many "cringe films" because she needed money. "I needed to pay the rent. I had bills to pay. My family was going through tough times," she added. "Many times I thought 'Why am I doing this?’ but then I'd think, 'When is the next paycheque coming'...I'd rather do the cringe and take...paycheque home," Sonali said.

70.title: US is adding fuel to fire by supplying Ukraine with rockets: Russia
70.article_body: Russia has accused the US of "deliberately pouring oil on the fire" by supplying advanced rocket systems to Ukraine. "The US is obviously holding the line that it will fight Russia to the last Ukrainian," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. He added that Moscow did not trust Kyiv to not use the weapons to fire into Russian territory.

71.title: Pic of the day: Govt on photo of Alaknanda river flowing into Bhagirathi river
71.article_body: In a bid to boost tourism, the government on Wednesday shared a photo of Alaknanda river flowing into Bhagirathi river in Uttarakhand and called it "picture of the day". "Like a river flows...This 'flawless' image of the Alaknanda river from the point where it flows into Bhagirathi in Devprayag is giving us major #TravelGoals," it tweeted.

72.title: Aus coach McDonald tests COVID-19 +ve, SL tour to go ahead as scheduled
72.article_body: Australia's newly-appointed head coach Andrew McDonald tested positive for COVID-19 ahead of their T20 side's departure for Sri Lanka, where they are set to play three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests. The tour is set to go ahead as scheduled with assistant coach Michael Di Venuto playing the role of the interim coach till McDonald joins the squad.

73.title: Traffic curbs in Hyderabad for Telangana Formation Day tomorrow
73.article_body: Traffic restrictions will be imposed in Hyderabad from 7.30 am to 11 am on June 2 (Thursday) for the Telangana Formation Day celebrations. Events will be held at Public Gardens in Nampally. Traffic coming from MJ Market and proceeding towards Public Gardens won't be allowed and it'll be diverted at Taj Island towards Ek Minar-Bhazarghar-Asif Nagar/ Red hills-Ayodya Hotel, Lakdikapul.

74.title: Iran used stolen UN's documents to evade nuclear probes: Israel
74.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said that Iran used documents stolen from UN nuclear watchdog IAEA "to systematically evade nuclear probes". In a video posted on Twitter, Bennett showed what he said were copies of Iran's "deception plan", including handwritten notes in Persian which said Iran needed to prepare a "cover story". Iran hasn't yet responded to Bennett's claims.

75.title: Nobody considered GT even among the top 4 teams who could qualify: Gill
75.article_body: Talking about GT's IPL 2022 triumph, the team's opener Shubman Gill said, "Nobody considered GT a threat among the teams and nobody considered us even in the top four teams who [could] qualify." "When people were saying that, it did not make sense to me," added Gill. "Tough players and tough teams...last if they have the right mind," stated Gill.

76.title: Country facing wheat crisis due to BJP's faulty economic policies: Mamata
76.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged that the country is facing a crisis in wheat supply due to faulty economic policies of BJP-led central government. She further criticised the Centre for demonetisation and demanded that financial dues of the state be cleared. "If you can't pay...money to states, you have no right to govern this country," Mamata added.

77.title: Govt agencies do their work: Anurag Thakur on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
77.article_body: Soon after ED summoned Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the government agencies do their work. They have been summoned in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to National Herald. Meanwhile, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said BJP is using "puppet agencies" to intimidate political opponents.

78.title: Communication satellite GSAT-24 to be launched on June 22: ISRO
78.article_body: ISRO will launch India's communication satellite GSAT-24 from Kourou in French Guiana on June 22, the organisation confirmed on Tuesday. Weighing 4,180 kg, GSAT-24 is a 24-Ku band communication satellite with pan-India coverage to meet DTH application needs. After completing the assembly, integration and environmental test, the satellite was cleared by PSR (Pre-Shipment Review) committee on May 2.

79.title: Bengaluru-based fintech unicorn slice raises $50 million
79.article_body: Bengaluru-based fintech startup slice has raised $50 million from Tiger Global and investors including Moore Strategic Ventures, Insight Partners and GMO VenturePartners. The funding reportedly raises slice's valuation to $1.5 billion-$1.8 billion, however, it could vary once the round finally closes. Founded by former Flipkart employee Rajan Bajaj, slice was valued at above $1 billion last year.

80.title: Our projects are compliant with Indus Waters Treaty: India to Pak
80.article_body: Indian hydropower projects are compliant with provisions of Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) and it's committed to bilateral resolution of issues with Pakistan, India said at 118th meeting of Permanent Indus Commission. India stated that it'll continue providing Pakistan with advance flood information as envisaged in the treaty. Under IWT, waters of Sutlej, Beas and Ravi rivers are allocated to India.

81.title: Switzerland vetoes Denmark's request to send Ukraine armoured vehicles
81.article_body: Switzerland's government has vetoed Denmark's request to provide Swiss-made armoured vehicles to war-hit Ukraine, citing its neutrality policy of not supplying arms to conflict zones, Swiss broadcaster SRF said. Switzerland requires foreign nations that buy its arms to seek permission to re-export them. Switzerland in April opposed Germany's request to re-export Swiss-made ammunition to Ukraine.

82.title: He initiated banter on flight, apologised for not letting me sleep: Chang on KK
82.article_body: Actor-singer Meiyang Chang recalled a flight incident with late singer KK and said KK initiated "an arresting banter" and kept apologising for not letting Chang sleep. "'How often...will we get...time to talk like this in our busy lives...bro?' was his reasoning," Chang wrote on Instagram. He added that by end of flight, he was glad they chose talking over sleeping.

83.title: Riyan not that big a player, hasn't shown any progress: Madan Lal
83.article_body: Former India cricketer Madan Lal has criticised RR batter Riyan Parag for his performance in the IPL, stating that the 20-year-old hasn't shown any progress in the last four seasons. "Riyan has played all matches but hasn't given a single performance. When you talk of him...he is not that big a player who can change the game," added Lal.

84.title: Ever seen criminal say I'm criminal?: Nadda on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
84.article_body: Soon after ED summoned Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, BJP chief JP Nadda asked, "Have you ever seen a criminal say I'm a criminal?" Nadda added, "They (Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi) will of course deny it. Documents are proof." They have been summoned in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to National Herald.

85.title: Hurricane Agatha kills at least 11 in Mexico; 20 go missing
85.article_body: At least 11 people were killed and 20 went missing in Mexico's Oaxaca due to floods and landslides caused by Hurricane Agatha, said Governor Alejandro Murat. He said the rivers overflowed and swept away people from homes and many were buried under mud and rocks. Agatha was the strongest hurricane ever recorded to make landfall in the month of May.

86.title: Kashmiri Pandits are again being killed as they were in 1990s: Kejriwal
86.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said that what happened with Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s, the same thing is happening with them now. "They are being targeted and killed in their houses, offices and roads (again)," he added. ''I appeal to the Centre that we have to work together to re-establish them in Kashmir," Kejriwal stated.

87.title: Teacher shot dead a day after transfer in J&K, Tuesday was her last day at school
87.article_body: Raj Kumar, the husband of 36-year-old school teacher Rajni Bala who was shot dead in Kashmir on Tuesday, has blamed the administration. After repeated requests, Bala was finally transferred to a safer area on Monday night and Tuesday was her last day at the old school, Kumar said. "Had the administration transferred her earlier, she might be alive," Kumar added.

88.title: Rahul is not like Rohit who is in a different league with Kohli: Latif
88.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said opener KL Rahul is not like Rohit Sharma, adding that Rohit and Virat Kohli belong to a "different" league. "[Rahul] needs to improve...He plays a few too many dot balls...When he was playing for [PBKS in IPL], I noticed the same," stated Latif. Rahul scored 616 runs in IPL 2022 for LSG.

89.title: China conducts military ‘readiness patrol’ around Taiwan
89.article_body: The Chinese military said on Wednesday it'd conducted a combat "readiness patrol" in the seas and airspace around the self-ruled island of Taiwan in recent days. The exercises were "a necessary action" against "US-Taiwan collusion", it added. Recently, US President Joe Biden had said America would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded it. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

90.title: Vaze allowed to turn approver in corruption case against ex-Maha minister Deshmukh
90.article_body: A CBI court has allowed dismissed Mumbai Police officer Sachin Vaze to turn approver and depose as a prosecution witness in a corruption case involving former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh. Earlier, Vaze had expressed his desire to become an approver in the case. Both CBI and ED are investigating corruption allegations against Deshmukh.

91.title: Bombay HC grants bail to pregnant woman accused of abetting husband's suicide
91.article_body: Bombay High Court granted pre-arrest bail to a pregnant woman accused of abetting her husband's suicide and said it's court's duty to protect her and the child. The deceased's father alleged that the woman betrayed his son and quarrelled with him a month before his death. She, however, claimed her husband was stressed as her father-in-law demanded dowry from her.

92.title: Spain detects 12 new monkeypox cases, tally reaches 132
92.article_body: Spain reported 12 new monkeypox cases on Tuesday taking the total number of infections to 132. At least 96 cases were reportedly detected in the Madrid region, nine in Catalonia, six in Canary Islands, four in Andalusia and three in the Basque region. All the patients are reportedly facing mild symptoms and are being isolated at home.

93.title: Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss attends actor's London concert: Report
93.article_body: British model Kate Moss reportedly attended actor Johnny Depp's rock concert in London. According to the reports, Depp had invited Moss to be his guest at the concert. This comes after Moss had testified in Depp's ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard. Moss had denied the claims that Depp had pushed her down the stairs during their relationship.

94.title: Someone wrote we're like Amitabh Bachchan-Manmohan Desai: Ranveer on Rohit
94.article_body: Speaking about working with filmmaker Rohit Shetty, actor Ranveer Singh said that he felt very safe working with him. "More than a creative collaborator-filmmaker, he's like a brother to me," he added. "I remember at the time of 'Simmba' coming across a part of a review where someone had written, 'This looks like...new Manmohan Desai and Amitabh Bachchan'," Ranveer said.

95.title: Coffee drinkers may be at lower risk of early death: Study
95.article_body: Researchers analysed coffee drinking habits of 1,71,000 UK residents for over seven years and found that drinking coffee can extend your lifespan. Researchers found that coffee drinkers were less likely to develop fatal cases of cancer and heart diseases as compared to others who didn't drink coffee. Moreover, as per study, people who drank slightly sweetened coffee lived longer too.

96.title: A fabulous singer and a great soul: Chiranjeevi on KK's demise
96.article_body: Telugu actor Chiranjeevi paid tribute to late singer KK who passed away on Tuesday in Kolkata. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Heartbroken at the shocking demise of KK. Gone too soon! A fabulous singer and a great soul." Chiranjeevi recalled that KK sang 'Dayi Dayi Damma' from 'Indra'. "My heartfelt condolences to his family and...dear ones," he further tweeted.

97.title: Satyendar Jain is patriot, should be given Padma Vibhushan: Kejriwal
97.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said Delhi minister Satyendar Jain is a patriot and he should be given "Padma Vibhushan". "Country should be proud of him, he gave Mohalla Clinic's model to Delhi. People from across the world come to see it," Kejriwal added. "Let everyone enquire...CBI has already cleared him, ED will as well," he stated.

98.title: Thanks to PM Modi for taking film industry global in big way: Akshay
98.article_body: Akshay Kumar, during an interview, was asked about the Indian film industry arriving on the international stage. To this, he replied, "All thanks to our Prime Minister [Narendra Modi] who has taken us so big in such a huge way internationally." This comes after India was named the official 'Country of Honour' at the Cannes Film Festival.

99.title: We met some time back, didn't know it would be our last meeting: Kapil on KK
99.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Twitter to share singer KK's picture and wrote he will always stay in everyone's hearts. "We had met some time back, it was a beautiful evening...I didn't know it would be our last meeting. My heart is sad...bye brother...Om Shanti," Kapil wrote. Singer Sonu Nigam also posted KK's video on Instagram and wrote, "Not done."

100.title: Development necessary but safeguarding environment equally important: SC
100.article_body: Supreme Court has said that development is necessary for the economy but safeguarding the environment for future generations is equally important. SC placed curbs on an Andhra Pradesh government tourism project in Visakhapatnam's Rushikonda Hill seeking to build a resort complex for tourism promotion. SC has allowed the state to undertake construction only on the flat area of the hill.

101.title: No security arrangements at venue for VIP: BJP leader on KK’s demise
101.article_body: Following singer KK’s demise, BJP state spokesperson Samik Bhattacharya said that security arrangements were not in place for a VIP at the venue where he performed on Tuesday evening in Kolkata. "Around 7,000 people were reportedly present at the venue of the programme where the seating capacity was around 3,000 people," Bhattacharya added. "He was mobbed there," he stated.

102.title: Badshah shares pic of abusive message he received after condoling KK's death
102.article_body: Rapper Badshah received an abusive message after condoling the demise of singer KK. He had shared a picture of KK on Instagram Stories and written 'Why?', after which he shared another story of the abusive message which read, "When will you die?" "Just to give you an idea what sort of hate we face on an everyday basis," wrote Badshah.

103.title: Defending champs India defeat Japan to win bronze medal in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey
103.article_body: Defending champions India defeated Japan 1-0 in the third place playoff match to bag bronze in the men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey. Raj Kumar Pal scored the only goal of the match. India, who have won the Asia Cup thrice and have finished second five times, bagged their second third-place finish in the tournament history.

104.title: Russia will add 15 yrs to my jail term: Kremlin critic Navalny
104.article_body: Imprisoned Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny said on Tuesday that Russian authorities have brought new charge against him and will add 15 years to his current jail term. Navalny stated that he's been accused of creating an extremist group "to incite hatred towards officials". His plea against his nine-year prison sentence for alleged fraud was dismissed by a Russian court recently.

105.title: When I joined B'wood people told me to fix my body, get a boob job done: Ananya
105.article_body: During her appearance on The Ranveer Show, Ananya Panday recalled facing casual sexism in her initial days in the industry. "As soon as I started working, people started saying things like 'You should fix this...like get a boob job or change something about your face'," she said. "They'd say, 'Fill up a little more. Put on some weight'," she added.

106.title: This tough situation is preparing Kohli for 110 int'l tons: Akhtar
106.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, Shoaib Akhtar said, "This tough situation is preparing [him] for 110 [international] centuries. People are writing [him] off...Things cannot get any worse." "Just go...and show everyone who Virat Kohli is," added Akhtar. "As a Pakistani, I am saying...he is the greatest player of all time...I want him to play till the age of 45," stated Akhtar.

107.title: Will donate to centrist Democrat & Republican candidates: Musk
107.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking about his political donations to Democrats and Republicans said, "I will donate to centrist candidates in both parties." The user had asked if Musk intends to maintain equality in political donations to both parties. An infographic was also shared showing Musk's equal donations to both parties in the past.

108.title: We'll treat all wastewater before it flows into Yamuna: Delhi CM
108.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday inspected India's largest sewage treatment plant (STP) at Coronation Pillar and said his government aims to treat all wastewater before it's discharged into Yamuna. Work on the state-of-the-art STP at Coronation Pillar was sanctioned in 2018 and it's currently undergoing a trial run. It'll benefit areas like Sant Nagar, Kamla Nagar, Bhalswa and Wazirabad.

109.title: AAP not letting central govt schemes reach Punjab's people: Hardeep Puri
109.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said the central government has started several welfare schemes which are benefitting people across the country. However, the Aam Aadmi Party government in Punjab is not allowing those schemes to reach common people, Puri said. He added that people in Punjab are being denied the benefits that can be availed from central government.

110.title: UP officer who was shot 7 times for exposing ₹83-crore scam clears UPSC exam
110.article_body: Uttar Pradesh provincial civil service officer Rinkoo Rahee, who was shot seven times in 2008 after exposing a scam, has cleared the UPSC Civil Services Examination, 2021. Rahee secured a rank of 683. He was involved in busting an ₹83-crore scholarships scam in Muzaffarnagar, following which eight people were charged and four were jailed for 10 years.

111.title: Main focus as coach is to pass knowledge about mental side of cricket: Watson
111.article_body: DC's assistant coach Shane Watson has said that his main focus as a coach is to pass knowledge about the mental side of cricket to as many players as he can. "Usually, coaches try to correct players' technique, but...if your mindset is not right, then you won't be able to execute your skills," he explained.

112.title: ₹10,000 cr for WB biggest fund allocation for railway projects: Union Min
112.article_body: Union Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw said that the Centre's allocation of ₹10,000 crore for railway projects in West Bengal is the "biggest ever allocation for railway projects". If the WB government would make land available, the Centre would expedite the projects, he added. Work would start immediately after identification and procurement of land, Vaishnaw further said.

113.title: 22-year-old woman swims from Bangladesh to India to marry boyfriend she met on Facebook
113.article_body: A 22-year-old woman from Bangladesh swam across a river for over an hour to cross the Indian-Bangladesh border to marry her boyfriend, who she had met on Facebook. The couple then drove to Kolkata, where they got married in a temple. However, Narendrapur Police arrested her for crossing the border illegally.

114.title: Modi govt now blind in fire of revenge: Cong on ED summons to Sonia, Rahul
114.article_body: After ED issued summons to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and party leader Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case, Congress said, "The Modi government has now turned blind in the fire of revenge." Party spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said, "They're experts in the politics of deviating from real issues." The alleged money laundering case is related to National Herald.

115.title: Russia stops gas supply to Denmark over refusal to pay in roubles
115.article_body: Russia has stopped supplying natural gas to Denmark's largest energy firm Ørsted after it refused to pay in roubles, said the company. "We stand firm in our refusal to pay in roubles and we've been preparing for this scenario," Ørsted CEO Mads Nipper said. Russia had earlier stopped supplying gas to Finland, Poland, Bulgaria and the Netherlands amid Ukraine war.

116.title: Transfer duty on property purchases over ₹25 lakh in Delhi hiked by 1%: Report
116.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has hiked the transfer duty on purchase of property above ₹25 lakh by 1%, PTI reported citing official sources on Wednesday. With this, the transfer duty will be 4% for men and 3% for women in Delhi, officials said. The hike in transfer duty is set to raise property prices in Delhi.

117.title: KK said 'Hero is paraplegic, I'll sit & sing': Bhansali on Guzaarish
117.article_body: Talking about late singer KK who sang songs for his film 'Guzaarish', filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said, "KK insisted on sitting on a chair to sing the songs...Normally singers stand and record their songs." "His reason was simple: 'The hero (Hrithik Roshan) is a paraplegic, he will sing the songs from a seated position, so will I'," added Bhansali.

118.title: His heartbreak songs leave many heartbroken today: Smriti Irani pays tribute to KK
118.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani paid tribute to singer KK who passed away in Kolkata on Tuesday. Sharing the video of the singer's popular song 'Pal' on Instagram, Smriti wrote, "His heartbreak songs leave many heartbroken today." "Every moment found an emotion in his voice...every memory of my youth is laced with his soothing sounds," she added.

119.title: Unknown person sends morphed pics to woman BJP functionary in Maha
119.article_body: An unidentified person allegedly sent morphed obscene pictures of a woman BJP functionary in Maharashtra on her contact number. The person also allegedly threatened her to make her morphed photos viral on social media and defame her, an official said. Police have registered a case based on a complaint filed by the woman.

120.title: Adipurush is made on ₹500 crore budget, we know people will come see: Bhushan
120.article_body: Producer Bhushan Kumar said 'Adipurush' is being made on budget of ₹500 crore. "For that film, we know that the opening will be giant with houseful board across...We know people will come to see it irrespective of pricing as it is a one of it's kind event...So, we would make sure, to go all out with this film," Kumar added.

121.title: Wheat can't be used as weapon of war: Pope on Ukraine export block
121.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday urged authorities to lift the block on Ukrainian wheat exports stating that the grain cannot be used as "weapon of war". "The [block] is very worrying because...lives of millions of people depend on it, especially in poorer countries," Pope added. Ukraine is unable to export wheat supplies due to Russian blockade of its Black Sea ports.

122.title: Nobody paid heed to Sikhs’ requirements for 70 years: JP Nadda
122.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Wednesday said that for 70 years no one paid heed to the requirements of Sikhs. "The task of connecting India with Pakistan via the Kartarpur corridor was undertaken by PM Narendra Modi at a cost of ₹120 crore," Nadda added while addressing devotees at Gurudwara Nanak Tekri in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.

123.title: Mumbai reports 506 new COVID-19 cases, highest since Feb 6; positivity rate up to 6%
123.article_body: Mumbai recorded 506 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday. Reports said that this is the city's highest daily rise in the COVID-19 cases since February 6. The test positivity rate in the city has increased to 6 per cent. Data by the Maharashtra Health Department reportedly said that the city reported over 200% more COVID-19 cases in May than in April.

124.title: KK's voice touched your heart, 1 in million singers has this gift: Lalit
124.article_body: Music composer Lalit Pandit said late singer KK had a rare gift of a voice that would touch your heart, adding that "one in a million" singers has this gift. "[His voice] had a unique kashish...which attracted youth to hear him more and more," stated Lalit. "He worked less in this industry and wasn't...a part of the rat-race," said Lalit.

125.title: Germany to supply anti-aircraft missiles, radar systems to Ukraine
125.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said that Berlin will supply anti-aircraft missiles and radar systems to help Ukraine fight Russia. He said Ukraine will be given IRIS-T missiles. These missiles are said to be capable of shooting down air-to-air and surface-to-air missiles. Germany has supplied 1.5 crore rounds of ammunition and one lakh hand grenades so far, Scholz added.

126.title: FPIs sell ₹45,276 cr in May, 2nd highest outflow since Mar 2020
126.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹45,276 crore in May 2022, the second highest monthly foreign investment outflow since March 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic had triggered a nationwide lockdown. The outflow in May also marks the eighth consecutive month when FPIs have remained net sellers. FPIs have withdrawn approximately net ₹2.5 lakh crore since October 2021.

127.title: Man sets himself on fire as onlookers take selfies in Istanbul; pics surface
127.article_body: A man set himself on fire at a crowded place in Turkey's Istanbul, videos and pictures of which have surfaced online. A picture showed people taking selfies with the man on fire in the background. A video showed a man coming out of a restaurant with a fire extinguisher and putting out the fire.

128.title: Israeli troops shoot & kill knife-wielding Palestinian woman
128.article_body: Israeli troops shot and killed a knife-wielding Palestinian woman in the occupied West Bank on Wednesday, the Palestinian Health Ministry said. The woman was shot after she advanced "toward an IDF [Israel Defence Force] soldier who was conducting routine security activity", the Israeli military said. No soldiers were injured in the incident, the military added.

129.title: Gun salute accorded to KK in presence of his family & West Bengal CM, video surfaces
129.article_body: Late Singer KK was honoured with gun salute by the West Bengal government at Rabindra Sadan in the presence of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and his family on Wednesday. Banerjee also paid her last respects to the singer. A large number of people gathered to pay their tribute to the late singer.

130.title: Alternate stretch for Pune's Sinhgad road to open to traffic in 15 days
130.article_body: The alternate stretch for Pune's Sinhgad road will be ready for people in 15 days, BJP MLA Madhuri Misal said on Tuesday. She said the concretisation work of the road behind PL Deshpande garden has been completed and work of pruning the trees will be done. The Sinhgad road is the only road to reach areas including Donje and Khadakwasla.

131.title: 43-yr-old man tries to save bird on Mumbai's sea link, run over by taxi
131.article_body: A 43-year-old man was run over by a speeding taxi on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link, police said. The victim got down from his car to save a bird which was hit by his vehicle. Police added they will not withdraw FIR lodged against the taxi driver. "Taxi drivers have to see objects from a distance of 100 metres," police stated.

132.title: Kartik denies reports of him replacing Akshay in 'Housefull' franchise
132.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has denied reports claiming that he'll be replacing Akshay Kumar in the 'Housefull' franchise. Taking to Twitter, Kartik shared a link to the news report and wrote, "Will anyone even bother to ask me what my next film is?" This comes a day after Kartik denied another report claiming he hiked his fee after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' success.

133.title: He was a part of my career & a lot of my songs: Akshay on KK's demise
133.article_body: Condoling the demise of singer KK, Akshay Kumar said, "He was part of my career, he was a part of my lots of songs. In 'Airlift', he sang a big song that was part of the climax (Tu Bhoola Jise)." "It was because of that song...the climax sounded...good. It was a very shocking thing what happened last night.” Akshay added.

134.title: Maybe Mayank was under pressure due to captaincy: Harbhajan Singh
134.article_body: Talking about PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal's performance in the recently-concluded IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said the 31-year-old should've been given more "freedom" in the tournament. "Can't quite believe what happened to him...maybe he was under pressure due to captaincy," added Harbhajan. Mayank scored 196 runs at an average of 16.33 in his 12 innings in IPL 2022.

135.title: 12-yr-old girl with special needs sexually assaulted in Pune district
135.article_body: A 65-year-old man allegedly sexually assaulted a 12-year-old girl with special needs in Pimpri-Chinchwad. The accused and his 28-year-old accomplice have been arrested. The younger man dragged the girl behind a heap of soil next to a public road before the assault. Both the accused work as labourers and live in the same slum area as the girl.

136.title: Elderly couple dies after 4-storey building catches fire in UP's Jhansi
136.article_body: A 70-year-old man and his 65-year-old wife died on Wednesday morning after a four-storey building caught fire in UP's Jhansi district. As the fire erupted, some LPG cylinders exploded and the blaze engulfed the entire building. While the couple died after being trapped in the fire, other family members suffered injuries and were rushed to a hospital.

137.title: Video shows KK's last interaction with crowd before he was rushed out of concert venue
137.article_body: A video shows late singer KK's last interaction with the crowd at the venue where he was performing on Tuesday evening. "God bless you all," he can be heard saying, moments before turning around and being escorted out of the venue. A visibly uncomfortable KK was escorted out of the venue by some men.

138.title: 'Spiderman' fined ₹2.25 lakh in Singapore for flouting COVID rules
138.article_body: A 19-year-old Indian-origin man in Singapore was fined SGD 4,000 (₹2.25 lakh) for flouting COVID-19 guidelines during New Year's Eve celebrations last year. The man, Kotra Venkata Sai Rohankrishna, who dressed up in Spiderman costume at party, pleaded guilty to breaching safety measures. Kotra was celebrating with eight others despite not being permitted to gather in groups larger than five.

139.title: Lawrence Bishnoi withdraws 'fake encounter' plea from Delhi HC, to move another court
139.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, a suspect in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, has withdrawn from Delhi High Court his plea seeking protection over apprehension that Punjab Police will kill him in a "fake encounter". He stated that he will approach the Punjab & Haryana High Court instead. Canada-based gangster and Bishnoi's associate Goldy Brar allegedly claimed responsibility for the murder.

140.title: Foreign-origin cigarettes worth ₹91 lakh seized in Mizoram, 1 detained
140.article_body: The Serchhip Battalion of Assam Rifles on Tuesday recovered a huge quantity of foreign-origin cigarettes in Mizoram's Champhai district along the India-Myanmar border and detained one person. According to a senior official, the approximate cost of the recovered items is ₹91 lakh. Last month, foreign-origin cigarettes worth ₹23 crore were seized in Mizoram's Champhai district.

141.title: GST collection falls 16% to ₹1.41 lakh cr from record high in April
141.article_body: GST collection in May 2022 fell 16% to ₹1.41 lakh crore from an all-time high of ₹1.68 lakh crore in April 2022, Finance Ministry's data showed. GST collection in May 2022, however, rose 44% YoY from ₹97,821 crore GST collected in May 2021. The ministry clarified that the returns in May have always been lesser than that in April.

142.title: Mumbai Police books BJP leader Mohit Kamboj for ₹52 crore scam
142.article_body: Economic Offences Wing of Mumbai Police has booked BJP leader Mohit Kamboj for fraud. The manager of Indian Overseas Bank had filed a complaint claiming that Kamboj and two other directors of a company took ₹52 crore loan from bank but didn't use it for intended work. "Police has filed a fabricated FIR against me," Kamboj said, denying the allegations.

143.title: MSRTC’s 1st e-bus 'Shivaee' launched on Pune-Ahmednagar route
143.article_body: Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation's (MSRTC) first electric bus service was launched on Wednesday on the Pune-Ahmednagar route. The bus named 'Shivaee' was inaugurated by Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar at the corporation's regional office premises in Pune. The Maharashtra government will work on inducting a large number of e-buses to replace the current fleet of buses, Pawar said.

144.title: Hardik and Pant will be explosive combination for Team India: Gavaskar
144.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said the combination of wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant and all-rounder Hardik Pandya in Team India's middle-order will be "explosive" in T20Is. "From the 14th to the 20th over, in six overs, you can probably expect even maybe 100-120 runs," added Gavaskar. Hardik led GT to IPL 2022 win in their maiden IPL season.

145.title: PM, this isn’t a movie, it’s reality of Kashmir today: Rahul on teacher’s killing
145.article_body: A day after a Kashmiri Pandit teacher was shot dead by terrorists in J&K, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that Kashmiri Pandits are protesting for the past 18 days but BJP is busy celebrating eight years of government. "Prime Minister, this is not a film, it is the reality of Kashmir today," Gandhi tweeted.

146.title: Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi summoned by ED in alleged money laundering case
146.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in an alleged money laundering case related to National Herald, which was closed in 2015. "The BJP is using puppet agencies to intimidate political opponents," Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said. "All companies do improve balance sheet by turning loans into equities," Singhvi added.

147.title: Humans could land on an asteroid between 2071 & 2087: Research
147.article_body: After analysing NASA's budget and evolution of technologcal capabilities of deep space exploration over years, researchers have proposed that a single or a group of spacefaring nations will send astronauts on mission to asteroid belt beyond Mars between 2071 and 2087. A mission to Jovian system and Saturn system may happen between 2087 to 2101 and 2129 to 2153, respectively.

148.title: Professor sent on 1-month leave after video shows him offering namaz in UP college
148.article_body: After a video of a professor offering namaz in premises of Shri Varshney College in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh went viral, he was sent on one-month leave on Tuesday. Members of BJP youth wing and other Hindu organisations reportedly protested after video went viral and sought legal action against the professor. The college principal said probe in the matter is underway.

149.title: It is becoming super difficult: Rafael Nadal on his foot pain
149.article_body: Rafael Nadal said the chronic foot pain being experienced by him requires a solution or improvement, as it is becoming "super difficult" for him. "I don't know [what will] happen [from] here," added Nadal. Nadal defeated world number one Novak Djokovic in the French Open quarter-final 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4). He will face Alexander Zverev in the semi-final.

150.title: UPSC aspirant shares marksheet, says '10 years of hard work ended in ashes'; tweet viral
150.article_body: A UPSC aspirant named Rajat Sambyal took to Twitter to share his marksheet of his last attempt of the exam. "10 years of hard work ended in ashes. 6 UPSC attempts over. 3 times prelims failed. 2 times mains failed. In my last attempt...I succumbed due to low score in interview...Missed by 11 marks. 'And still I rise'," he wrote.

151.title: Someone, please tell me it's not true: Pritam on singer KK's death
151.article_body: Music composer Pritam Chakraborty mourned the demise of singer KK on Twitter. "In utter shock. Just heard about KK. Someone, please tell me it's not true." Pritam tweeted. The duo worked together on several songs like 'Zara Sa', 'Alvida' and 'Dil Ibaadat'. Singer Adnan Sami also mourned KK's death and tweeted, "I can't process this...[I'm in] utter shock and disbelief."

152.title: Venue of KK's concert was overcrowded, bouncers sprayed foam to disperse crowd: Staff
152.article_body: A staff member of Nazrul Mancha Auditorium in Kolkata, who was present during KK's concert, revealed the venue was overcrowded and the bouncers had to spray foam to disperse the crowd. The staff member said that KK was feeling unwell during his performance and added that KK took a break and performed again. KK passed away aged 53 on Tuesday.

153.title: Not my job to question about policies: Akshay Kumar on asking PM Modi if he eats mangoes
153.article_body: Speaking about interviewing Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Akshay Kumar said, "As a common man, I just wanted to ask him very simple, straight questions." On being questioned about asking PM Modi if he eats mangoes during the interview, the actor said, "It's not my job to ask about the policies...It all looks fake if I would do that."

154.title: Congratulatory messages are still coming in: Arshdeep on India call-up
154.article_body: PBKS' 23-year-old pacer Arshdeep Singh, who earned his maiden India call-up for the upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa, has revealed that he got the news of his selection while travelling for an IPL 2022 game and he "didn't feel much" at that time. "Now, I'm feeling really good as congratulatory messages are still coming in...I'm grateful," he added.

155.title: Mapmaker TomTom to cut 10% of workforce due to improved automation
155.article_body: Mapmaker TomTom has said it will cut 10% of its workforce globally as it steps up its automated mapmaking capability. TomTom CEO Harold Goddijn said higher levels of automation would build better, broader maps enabling it to address a wider market. "Regrettably, this will have an intended impact on approximately 500 employees in our Maps unit," TomTom said.

156.title: Jharkhand govt orders probe into BJP leaders' 'disproportionate assets'
156.article_body: The Jharkhand government ordered a probe into the alleged disproportionate assets of five former ministers of the previous BJP government. This comes after a plea was filed in Jharkhand High Court against the leaders - Amar Bauri, Nilkanth Singh Munda, Neera Yadav, Randhir Singh and Lois Marandi. Their assets grew by up to 1200% in five years, claimed the petition.

157.title: Working on the songs KK sang was always more special: Emraan Hashmi
157.article_body: Emraan Hashmi paid tribute to singer KK on Twitter. "A voice and talent like no other. They don't make them like him anymore. Working on the songs he sang was always that much more special," he tweeted. Emraan featured in several songs sung by KK like 'Beete Lamhein', 'Dil Ibaadat' and 'Zara Sa'. KK, aged 53, passed away on Tuesday.

158.title: People haven't stopped crying after hearing KK's 'Tadap...' for 23 years: Ismail
158.article_body: Discussing the song 'Tadap Tadap Ke' from 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' sung by late singer KK, the film's music director Ismail Darbar said KK was straightforward in admitting he "couldn't" sing it when they first met. Ismail added he was impressed by KK's honesty. "The way KK sang...people haven't stopped crying after hearing it for 23 years," stated Ismail.

159.title: Scientists identify novel disease that affects liver & kidneys together
159.article_body: Scientists have identified a novel inherited disease, TULP3-related ciliopathy that causes kidney and liver failure in children and adults. They have found a faulty gene that acts as catalyst in increasing fibrosis in liver and kidney, resulting in their failure. The findings would help them give patients a precise diagnosis which would facilitate relevant treatment for best possible results.

160.title: New Australian govt includes record 13 women ministers
160.article_body: Australia's new government was sworn in on Wednesday. Of the 30 ministers appointed to the new government, 13 are women. Women also hold a record 10 spots out of 23 in core Cabinet roles. Youth Minister Anne Aly became Australia's first female Muslim minister, while Industry and Science Minister Ed Husic is the first Muslim to serve in Cabinet.

161.title: Yamuna Expressway authority hikes land allotment rates by up to 38%
161.article_body: Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) has hiked land allotment rates in the area by up to 38% for different categories, officials said. The new rates will be effective from April 2022-23 fiscal and will be applicable in all segments except commercial lands, officials added. This comes in the wake of the work on Noida international airport, officials stated.

162.title: 'Om..' didn't work but KK's spirit for song encouraged me in bad times: Anupam
162.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video of song from his movie 'Om Jai Jagadish' and said that he can't believe that singer KK, who sang the song, has "left us". "The film didn't work but the spirit with which KK sang this song...always encouraged me in my bad times....Will be missed a lot friend," he wrote.

163.title: I would give the Ballon d'Or to Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr: Neymar
163.article_body: Former Barcelona forward Neymar said he would give the Ballon d'Or for this year to Real Madrid's Brazilian attacker Vinicius Jr. "Kylian Mbappe had a great season, Karim Benzema too," added Neymar. Vinicius scored the winner for Real Madrid in their recent Champions League final against Liverpool, to help his side win the Champions League for a record-extending 14th time.

164.title: Samson reinvented himself in IPL 2022, he played selfless cricket: Saba Karim
164.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim has said RR captain Sanju Samson reinvented himself in the recently-concluded IPL 2022. "Sanju played selfless cricket...I agree there [were] one or two instances where he [didn't score]...runs that were required on the big occasions but the finesse and timing [could be] seen in his batting," explained Karim. Samson scored 458 runs in IPL 2022.

165.title: KK had insisted I sing Aashayein chorus instead of him: Salim Merchant
165.article_body: Composer-singer Salim Merchant paid tribute to singer KK, who passed away on Tuesday at 53. Salim recalled an incident where KK asked Salim to sing the 'Aashayein' chorus instead of him. "KK was the lead singer, but he had the heart...to let me sing an important part," he added. Taking to Twitter, Salim wrote, "I'm speechless...broken with you leaving us...suddenly."

166.title: Central govt selling PSUs, implementing anti-labour laws: TRS leader
166.article_body: TRS leader and Telangana MLC K Kavitha on Tuesday criticised BJP-led central government while accusing it of selling the Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs). Kavitha also accused the Centre of implementing "anti-labour laws" alleging that the Modi government has "duped" public with reforms carried out in its eight years of tenure. "TRS government is fighting against such laws (reforms)," she added.

167.title: Mumbai civic body draws lottery for ward reservation; women get 118 seats
167.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Tuesday drew a lottery for reservation of wards for SC, ST and general category seats for women without OBC quota. As many as 118 of 236 BMC seats will be reserved for women. Eight of these seats will be reserved for SC candidates, one seat for ST candidates and 109 for the general category candidates.

168.title: Congress leader Brijesh Kalappa resigns, cites lack of passion
168.article_body: Senior Congress leader and Supreme Court advocate Brijesh Kalappa has resigned from the party. In a letter to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, Kalappa said, "I have been representing the party on Hindi, English and Kannada channels since the UPA years in 2013." "But, in the recent past, I have been finding myself lacking in passion," he added.

169.title: Ram Mandir will be national temple of India, symbol of country's unity: UP CM
169.article_body: The Ram Mandir being built in Ayodhya will be the "national temple of India", UP CM Yogi Adityanath said on Wednesday. CM Yogi laid the foundation stone for Ram Mandir's Garbhagriha in Ayodhya today. "People have been waiting for this day for a long time. Ram Mandir will be a symbol of India's unity," CM Yogi added.

170.title: I gave my best, lost to a better player: Djokovic after defeat against Nadal
170.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said he was proud of the fight he put up against Rafa Nadal in the French Open quarter-final as he lost to a "better player". He added, "Had my chances. Didn't use them...You know, over four hours' battle, and I have to accept this defeat." Nadal won the match 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4).

171.title: Pakistani singer Shae Gill gets trolled for post on Sidhu Moosewala; she replies
171.article_body: Pakistani singer Shae Gill, who gained fame after featuring in Coke Studio song 'Pasoori', was trolled on social media for condoling Sidhu Moosewala's death. "As a Muslim, you're not allowed to make dua for non-Muslims when they die," someone messaged her. Gill replied, "I'm a Christian, belong to a Christian family and can make prayers for people from different religions."

172.title: Wanted to quit ODIs when Dhoni dropped me in 2008, Sachin stopped me from retiring: Sehwag
172.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has revealed that he wanted to quit ODI cricket when MS Dhoni dropped him from the playing XI in a series against Australia in 2008. "I thought I will continue playing only Test cricket. Sachin Tendulkar stopped me at the time. He said, 'This is a bad phase of your life. Just wait'," Sehwag added.

173.title: Death toll from heavy rains in northeast Brazil reaches 106
173.article_body: The death toll from flooding and landslides following heavy rains in northeast Brazil has reached 106, the government said. At least 10 people are still missing. "We'll not stop until we find all those missing," Pernambuco state's Governor, Paulo Camara, said. Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Monday flew over the affected areas and pledged support for those who'd been impacted.

174.title: Not fair, how can you just go; a brother is gone: Mohit Chauhan on KK's death
174.article_body: Singer Mohit Chauhan took to Twitter to share his picture with late singer KK to say he is in shock and grief. "KK...not fair man.
