PM Modi said this while addressing a rally in Shimla to mark the eighth anniversary of BJP government at the centre.

350.title: 33-yr-old man strangles his girlfriend, kills self in Thane
350.article_body: Police said that a 33-year-old man allegedly strangled his girlfriend to death and later killed himself in Maharashtra's Thane. An official said the incident took place when 33-year-old Anil Salunke visited the victim, 28-year-old Lalita Kale, at her apartment. Salunke was upset that Kale was marrying another man and went to meet her for the last time, the official added.

351.title: Couple, daughters aged 6 & 9 die by suicide near Hyderabad
351.article_body: A couple and their two daughters allegedly died by suicide after jumping into Kurmalguda lake near Hyderabad. The deceased have been identified as Quddus Pasha (37), Fatima (28), Mehar (nine) and Firdous Begum (six). They allegedly consumed a poisonous substance before jumping into the lake.

352.title: Gurugram Police arrests maid for stealing ₹16 lakh from ex-employer
352.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Monday said that a maid was arrested for stealing jewellery worth ₹15 lakh and cash worth ₹1 lakh from the house of her ex-employer in Sector 50. The stolen cash and jewellery were recovered from her possession, the police added. The husband of the accused, a suspect in the case, is absconding, the police further said.

353.title: 'Goldy Brar' who posted pic with Mann clarifies he's not the gangster, says 'Pic misused'
353.article_body: A man named Goldy Brar from Punjab clarified he's not the gangster Goldy Brar, suspected to be behind Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "I'm Goldy Brar, son of Rajinder Singh from...Jandwala. My picture is being misused on social media," he said. The man had posted a congratulatory message for Bhagwant Mann after he became CM and had posted a photo with him.

354.title: PM stops car to accept portrait of his mother from girl in Shimla
354.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday broke his high-security protocol to accept a portrait of his mother made by a girl in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla. The incident took place when PM Modi was taking part in a roadshow. Seeing the girl carrying the sketch of his mother, the PM asked for his car to be stopped to meet her.

355.title: Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi: Smriti Irani
355.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday alleged that the Gandhi family did politics from Uttar Pradesh's Amethi for decades, but kept the constituency's people "poor". "The Gandhi family always cheated people of Amethi," she claimed. Furthermore, she alleged that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had "left for Kerala in 2019" as he knew Amethi's people had "resentment" against the Gandhi family.

356.title: Demonetisation caused harm, people won't forget: Rahul to PM Modi
356.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said people will never forget the pain of demonetisation. In a Facebook post, Gandhi said the demonetisation exercise, introduced by PM Narendra Modi's government in 2016, was done "deliberately so that lakhs of crores of loans of 'Modi-friend' capitalists can be waived" off. Many died while waiting in line for money, he added.

357.title: We are secure, rumours don't affect us: Shamita on break-up reports with Raqesh
357.article_body: Actress Shamita Shetty reacted to the rumours of her break-up with her boyfriend Raqesh Bapat. She said, "We (Raqesh and I) have consciously made an effort to not let these things affect us too much." "A relationship is about two people...It can't be about the rest of the world...We both are very secure people...so it doesn’t affect us," she added.

358.title: AAP, Cong create propaganda, defame ED: BJP MP on Satyendar Jain's arrest
358.article_body: BJP MP Jugal Lokhandwala on Monday said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and Congress "deliberately create propaganda to defame the Enforcement Directorate (ED)". His comments came after AAP claimed that party leader Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in a "fake case". "The ED is doing its work...this is your political stunt, it's not going to work," Jugal added.

359.title: US Senator visits Taiwan as China ups military threat
359.article_body: US Senator Tammy Duckworth on Tuesday reiterated America's support for Taiwan on her second visit in a year to the island. Duckworth met Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen during the trip. China denounced the visit and said, "Taiwan is a province of China, and there's no so-called President." Thirty Chinese military jets had entered Taiwan's air defence zone on Monday.

360.title: 20,000 tickets unsold at Lord's ahead of Eng-NZ 1st Test: Reports
360.article_body: Almost 20,000 tickets have reportedly gone unsold for the first four days of the Test match between England and New Zealand at the Lord's Cricket Ground, London. As per a Daily Telegraph report, the Barmy Army has cited higher prices as the reason behind sluggish sales. "1,800 tickets available on day one, 2,500 on day two," the report said.

361.title: Federer has always been my idol growing up: 19-year-old Rune
361.article_body: Holger Rune, who became the first Danish man to reach quarter-finals at French Open, said 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has been his idol growing up. "Why I love him so much is basically his game, his transition to...net is very rare," he added. The 19-year-old beat world number four Stefanos Tsitsipas in Roland Garros fourth round on Monday.

362.title: 22-yr-old jailed for creating nuisance in drunken condition in Hyd
362.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday took to Twitter to inform that a 22-year-old man has been convicted in a petty case for creating nuisance in drunken condition and misbehaving with ladies in the city. Police further said that a court has sentenced the man, who has been identified as Bandi Akash, to 112 days of imprisonment in the case.

363.title: Govt land worth ₹5 cr freed of encroachments in MP's Jabalpur
363.article_body: The district administration in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur removed encroachments on around 24,340 sq ft of government land on Tuesday. According to an official, the land has a market value of ₹5 crore. These encroachments were removed in joint action by district administration, the police and municipal corporation under state government's initiative, said Additional Collector Namah Shivay Arjaria.

364.title: 2-day-old infant girl found inside Mumbai garbage bin, case lodged
364.article_body: A two-day-old infant girl was found abandoned inside a garbage bin in Mumbai's Mahim area on Tuesday. Following the recovery of the baby, a case has been registered against an unknown person for leaving the infant in the garbage bin near a cloth market area. Police are searching for the accused using CCTV footage.

365.title: US' National Guard may cooperate with Taiwan military: Prez Tsai
365.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said on Tuesday that the US' National Guard is mulling cooperation with Taiwan's armed forces. President Tsai's comment comes days after US President Joe Biden pledged that the US will defend Taiwan militarily in case China invades it. Notably, Taiwan has claimed that 30 Chinese warplanes entered its air defence zone on May 30.

366.title: My journey in B'wood has always been hard, difficult: Actress Aishwarya Raj
366.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Raj Bhakuni who will be seen in the upcoming Akshay Kumar starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', said her journey in Bollywood has "always" been hard and difficult. "When I came to Mumbai, I had no clue where I had to go. I had no godfather," added Aishwarya Raj. "It took me six years to reach here," she stated.

367.title: Not much difference: UP CM after Akhilesh said a child called him Rahul Gandhi
367.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claim that a child called him Rahul Gandhi when he was the CM, the current UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that there is not much difference between the two. "The only little difference is that Rahul Gandhi criticises India in foreign countries, while you (Akhilesh) do the same for UP when outside the state," he added.

368.title: Students unable to afford high fees going to countries like Ukraine: SC
368.article_body: The students who cannot afford to pay the high cost of medical courses are going to countries such as Ukraine, the Supreme Court said. Education has become a big industry in the country, SC added. The observation was made by the court while hearing a batch of pleas asking the government to process applications for setting up new pharmacy colleges.

369.title: 60-yr-old father, 26-yr-old son found dead in UP's Ballia
369.article_body: A man and his son were found dead in Sonavani village of Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district. The deceased, identified as Uma Shankar Singh (60) and Vikram Singh (26), were found in separate places in the village. Vikram's body was found inside a well while his father Uma's body was found at the family residence, police said.

370.title: 2 killed, 13 injured after minibus fell into gorge in Uttarkashi
370.article_body: Two persons were reportedly killed and 13 injured after a minibus they were travelling in fell into a 100-metre-deep gorge near Kopang Bend in Uttarkashi on Sunday. The deceased have been identified as Alka Bote, a doctor from Maharashtra's Aurangabad and Kartik Madhavan, a journalist from Coimbatore who worked for The Hindu, an official said. They were travelling to Gangotri.

371.title: Zomato shares surge over 48% in May, m-cap nears ₹60,000 crore
371.article_body: Shares of Zomato have surged over 48% in May with its total market capitalisation at ₹59,052 crore after the stock closed at ₹75 on Tuesday. The stock had hit a low of ₹50 apiece on May 11. Last week, Zomato announced its March quarter earnings and reported a loss of ₹360 crore and a 75% increase in consolidated revenue.

372.title: Raj Thackeray hospitalised in Mumbai, to undergo hip surgery tomorrow
372.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has been admitted to the Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai and he will undergo hip surgery on Wednesday, party leader Nitin Sardesai said. Thackeray had earlier this month said that he will undergo surgery for his knee and back problems. Recently, he had given a deadline to remove loudspeakers from mosques.

373.title: Actor Karan V Grover to tie the knot with Poppy Jabbal on June 1: Reports
373.article_body: Actor Karan V Grover is all set to tie the knot with his longtime actress-girlfriend Poppy Jabbal on June 1, according to reports. The wedding will reportedly take place in Himachal Pradesh in the presence of family members and friends. As per reports, actresses Shama Sikander and Sonnalli Seygall are among the people who have been invited to the wedding.

374.title: Johnny Depp performs with Jeff Beck in UK for second night in a row
374.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp performed with English guitarist Jeff Beck for the second night in a row on Monday at London's Royal Albert Hall. Jeff introduced Johnny saying, "He came knocking on my dressing room door about five years ago and we haven't stopped laughing since." This comes amid the jury's deliberation in Johnny's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

375.title: Can't mention Ronaldinho, Gareth Bale in same sentence: Rio Ferdinand
375.article_body: Ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said Real Madrid forward Gareth Bale and ex-Barcelona footballer Ronaldinho's names cannot be mentioned in the same sentence. Ferdinand added that Bale has had a "ridiculous" career, stating he is above Ronaldinho while considering Champions League success. He said the moments Ronaldinho has had in his career will live with generations of people forever.

376.title: BJP will do horse-trading and spoil atmosphere: Gehlot on RS polls
376.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that BJP will do horse-trading in the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections and spoil atmosphere of the state. "BJP fielded Subhash Chandra. They know they don't have sufficient votes so what will they do," he added. Randeep Singh Surjewala, Mukul Wasnik, and Pramod Tiwari have filed nominations as Congress candidates for Rajya Sabha polls from Rajasthan.

377.title: He has got all these opportunities: CM Nitish on not sending RCP Singh to RS
377.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar commented on his party JD(U)'s decision to not field Union Minister RCP Singh for the next month's Rajya Sabha biennial election. "He (RCP) has been sent to RS twice. He was also made JD(U) President and he is currently a minister in the Central government. So he has got all these opportunities," CM Nitish Kumar said.

378.title: BJP workers march towards TN Secretariat over tax on fuel prices
378.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai and party workers marched towards the state's Secretariat in Chennai in a protest over DMK-led state government not reducing tax on fuel prices on Tuesday. DMK promised to reduce the petrol and diesel prices "by ₹5 and ₹4 respectively" in its manifesto, Annamalai said. "We demand...state government to fulfil what it's promised," he added.

379.title: Man with rifle arrested after standoff with police outside Greek Parliament
379.article_body: A 37-year-old man carrying a hunting rifle has been arrested after a brief standoff with police outside the Greek Parliament. Tuesday's incident lasted a little over an hour and no one was injured, an official said. Last year in October, a 58-year-old man was arrested after driving a pickup truck onto a sidewalk in front of Parliament.

380.title: Many singers in Punjab give money and save themselves from gangsters: Mika Singh
380.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, in an interaction with News18, revealed that many singers in Punjab who are extorted by gangsters often end up paying them off. "Singers in Punjab often get such threats from gangsters...Many singers give money and save themselves," he stated. "Everyone knows they do so many shows and earn well," Mika added.

381.title: Kevin Pietersen picks his Team of IPL 2022, includes 5 overseas players
381.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen has picked his Team of IPL 2022, which includes five foreign players. He named Jos Buttler and Quinton De Kock as the openers of the team. He included Hardik Pandya as captain. Other players include KL Rahul, Liam Livingstone, Ravichandran Ashwin, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Umran Malik, Yuzvendra Chahal and Josh Hazlewood.

382.title: Gyanvapi survey pics & videos leaked, aired on TV after being given to petitioners
382.article_body: After the videos and pictures of the Gyanvapi Mosque survey were handed over to four female Hindu petitioners on Monday, the same were leaked and aired on TV channels and circulated online. The Varanasi district court gave sealed envelopes containing survey footage to the petitioners who submitted an affidavit promising not to leak them. They've denied leaking the footage.

383.title: Was honour to play opposite Sam, Laura & Jeff in 'Jurassic...': Chris
383.article_body: Actor Chris Pratt has said that it was an honour to work opposite Jeff Goldblum, Laura Dern and Sam Neill in 'Jurassic World Dominion'. "I loved Jurassic Park growing up...they were cemented in my mind as icons at a period in my life when I didn't even know what I was going to do for a living," he added.

384.title: Shiba Inu's anonymous Founder Ryoshi deletes all tweets, blogs
384.article_body: Shiba Inu's anonymous Founder Ryoshi has deleted all their tweets and Shiba Inu blogs from Medium website. In a now-deleted post, Ryoshi had said, "I am a nobody, I am not important...I am just some guy of no consequence...and I am replaceable." Rysohi's Twitter profile picture has been changed to include a picture of Buddhist yogi Jetsun Milarepa.

385.title: Delhi court summons Congress' Shivakumar in money laundering case
385.article_body: A Delhi court has summoned Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar in a money laundering case after taking cognisance of a chargesheet filed by ED. The court has directed him to appear before it on July 1. The case pertains to a 2018 chargesheet filed by the Income Tax Department against Shivakumar and others for alleged tax evasion and hawala dealings.

386.title: Siberian tundra could virtually disappear by mid-millennium: Research
386.article_body: As a result of rising temperatures in Arctic due to global warming, the treeline for Siberian larch forests is steadily advancing to the north. Experts warned that Siberian tundra could virtually disappear by mid-millennium as these forests are gradually supplanting the broad expanses of the region. Only consistent climate protection measures could roughly save 30% of the tundra, they said.

387.title: 1 dead, 62 fall sick after drinking contaminated water in K'taka
387.article_body: Raichur Institute of Medical Sciences Superintendent Dr Bhaskar K on Tuesday said one person was dead and 62 others, including 23 children, have been hospitalised after they consumed contaminated water in Karnataka's Raichur city. The people were hospitalised due to dehydration, following vomiting and diarrhoea. Locals alleged that the district administration was not responding to their appeals.

388.title: International institutions accepting poverty is reducing in India: PM
388.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that today India extends its hand for help and international institutions are also accepting that poverty is reducing in India. "In COVID-19, we sent medicines and vaccines to over 150 countries," PM Modi said in Shimla. "India has proved that we have the potential and we are also the performers," PM Modi added.

389.title: Singaporeans rush to stock up chicken as Malaysia bans exports
389.article_body: The Singaporeans reportedly rushed to stock up on fresh chicken, clearing out supermarkets, as Malaysia's ban on poultry export is set to kick in from Wednesday. The ban was announced by Malaysian PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob last week in a bid to let domestic prices and production stabilise. Notably, Singapore procures a third of its poultry requirements from Malaysia.

390.title: Salman's security increased after Lawrence Bishnoi accused in Moosewala murder
390.article_body: Actor Salman Khan's security has been increased after gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who threatened him in 2018, emerged as an accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Police will be present around [Salman's] apartment (in Mumbai) to make sure no nefarious activity is done," said a police official. Bishnoi had threatened Salman in Rajasthan in retaliation for alleged blackbuck poaching.

391.title: France bans use of English video gaming terms like 'e-sports' and 'streaming'
391.article_body: The French government is officially banning the use of English video gaming terms to preserve the purity of French language. As per the AFP, government officials will now be required to replace words such as 'e-sports' and 'streaming' with their approved French versions. France's Culture Ministry said the use of English terms could become a "barrier to understanding" for non-gamers.

392.title: 5 killed, 5 injured as mini-bus collides with auto-rickshaw in Gujarat
392.article_body: At least five people were killed and five others were injured after a mini-bus collided with an auto-rickshaw in Gujarat's Banaskantha, police said. The deceased include three women, in the age group of 20 to 50 years, a man and a 10-year-old boy, police added. The mini-bus was coming from Rajasthan when it collided head-on with the auto-rickshaw, police stated.

393.title: Report claims Culture Ministry to study 'racial purity' of Indians, govt says 'misleading'
393.article_body: The government on Tuesday said that a media report titled "Culture Ministry to study 'racial purity' of Indians" published on May 28 is misleading, mischievous and contrary to the facts. "The proposal is not related to establishing genetic history and 'trace the purity of races in India' as alluded in the article," the Ministry of Culture said in a statement.

394.title: B'wood has always seen me more as a glamorous person: Sonali
394.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre has said that the Hindi film industry has always seen her more as a glamorous person than as a serious actor. "I want that to change," she added. Sonali further said she has nothing against glamour and loves being glamorous, while adding, "But there is more to me. And I would like those layers to be explored."

395.title: The team invested 2 years on VFX of 'Samrat Prithviraj': Akshay
395.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that the makers of his upcoming film 'Samrat Prithviraj' invested two years of the pandemic on the VFX work of the film. The actor added that the film is truly a "visual extravaganza" as the "grandest tribute to the fearless king". He had earlier said that his costumes in the film weighed about 4-6 kg.

396.title: There will be 'no entry' for BJP in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Mamata
396.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that no matter how much the BJP tries there will be "no entry" for the party in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "There are no chances of the BJP returning to power," she said. "The citizens of the country are fed up with the anti-people government at the Centre," she further said.

397.title: Much of acting I know is what he taught me: Rasika on FTII professor Naseeruddin
397.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal spoke about the opportunity of collaborating with her Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) professor Naseeruddin Shah in 'The Miniaturist of Junagadh'. "One of the reasons was of course Naseer saheb. He taught me when I was [at] FTII and much that I know of acting today is because of what he taught me," she said.

398.title: There is truly no one like you: Mahesh Babu on his father's b'day
398.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, actor Mahesh Babu wished his father and veteran actor Krishna on his 79th birthday. "Happy birthday Nanna! There is truly no one like you. Wishing for your happiness and good health for many more years to come. Stay blessed always. Love you," he wrote. Recently, Mahesh had featured in 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata'.

399.title: I didn't click Depp-Heard honeymoon pic, shared it online: Russel Wong
399.article_body: Singaporean photographer Russel Wong shared the honeymoon picture of Johnny Depp and Amber Heard which shows a bruise under Depp's eye. Wong has stated that he did not click the picture, however, he did find the original picture as well as copies which showed Depp's bruise. Heard had claimed in the defamation trial against her that Depp Photoshopped the bruise.

400.title: Before 2014, talks were on scams, 'atki, latki, bhatki' schemes: PM
400.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday claimed that before 2014, talks used to be about things like scams, corruption, nepotism and "atki, latki, bhatki (stuck, hanging, derailed)" schemes. "But today talks are about benefits from govt schemes," he said. PM Modi made the remarks while addressing a meeting in Shimla as BJP-led government marks eight years at the Centre.
